loans.use: to buy more stocks of purified water and soft-drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes works hard to support her family. Agnes is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Agnes requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, detergent and snack foods.

Agnes has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Agnes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, detergent and snack foods.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle works hard to support her family. Anabelle is married and has a food business in the Philippines.

Anabelle requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Anabelle has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Anabelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 42 years old and married with 2 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ana Marie is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ana Marie has been farming rice for 3 years and also earns additional income from E-loading.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 23 years old and she is married to Daniel.Together they have two children.She sells second hand clothes and has been in the business for the past one year.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD.She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client.She will use the loan purchase stock of clothes for sale.

She hopes to open a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: Purchase stock of used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Domel

texts.en:
Domel is currently residing at Estefania, with her spouse and five children. Primary source of his income comes from backyard hog raising, farming and the transportation service. He owns and operates a van transportation service for almost three years. Domel was thankful for his businesses for he was able to pay his children's school expenses. He would like to provide maintenance of the vehicle so that he will continue the smooth operation of his business and generate good income from it. 

He is now asking for additional capital of P14,000 to pay for franchise renewal and maintenance of the vehicle.

Someday, with continuous effort, patience and faith with God, Domel will achieve a successful life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal and maintenance of the vehicle.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario and her spouse works untiringly is selling fruits and vegetables to the people in the village where they live. They had seven children. The youngest is sending to school. The rest had finished their education and had settled into marriage. The family's vending business was generating good income through affordable prices and friendly services they offered. Mario is also known to be humble. 

He is now borrowing a laon of P19,000 to buy cabbages, tomatoes and a sack of rice to sell. He hopes this loan will be granted to him as a way of improving and diversifying the business. 

Mario is praying for good health and a profitable business to achieve financial independence for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes and a sack of rice to sell

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a jolly person. Despite poverty in life, she still had the determination to succeed. Jesusa operates a small variety store in front of her house at Estefania. Jesusa had eight children. Two of them attends to high school education. She would like to acquire more customers and generate good profits from her business. From this, she is asking for a loan of P19,000 to buy additional items to vend. She will buy canned goods,  soft drinks, eggs and three sacks of rice. 

Jesusa would like to make the business more profitable in order to earn funds for college education of her children. When they earn for a degree, they will find a good job for the welfare of their own lives someday.

loans.use: to buy canned goods,  soft drinks, eggs and three sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a hardworking and a loving husband. He is 26 years old and had one child. His wife spend full time in nursing their child. To earn an income, Jonathan is selling beef and pork meat. He buys the meat at the public market and re-sells them at their village for profit. He had been doing it for two years now and earns P3,000 each month doing this activities.

He is now borrowing for a loan of P7,000 to buy more beef and pork meat to re-sell. He would like to continue operating this business and earn good profits for the sustenance of the family. In the future, he will also established a hog raising business for additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy more beef and pork meat to re-sell

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente, 52 years old resident of Estefania is a rice retailer who is married and had five children. Vicente is a hardworking father. Aside from the farming business, he also vends rice to the people in his village and acquire profits from it. He usually acquire P2,000 each sack of rice he sells. He had been doing it for almost five years. His income goes for school expenses for the two of his children who is currently attending to school.

To increase his income, he needs to sell more rice. In this matter, he is now borrowing for a loan of P10,000 to buy four sacks of rice to sell. He hopes to make his business more profitable so that he will continuously educate his children. 

Vicente will be very happy and proud if his children will finished their education and have a stable job someday.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Hosea

texts.en:
Hosea is 41 years old from Nakuru and is married to Anne, they have two children who are aged between 15 years and eight years old.

Hosea has a poultry business that he has been doing for the past 18 years.He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD, to enable him buy more chicken to add to his stock. He is optimistic that his business will do well.

He hopes to expand his business and be a wholesale supplier of chicken to big hotels and institutions.

loans.use: To buy more chicken to rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 35 years old, married and had four children attending to school. To make a living, and her spouse both involved in making pancit miki(colorful noodle made from flour) to sell. They offer their products at the public market and to the nearby villages. Valentina was thankful for the kind of business she had though she only generates minimal income from it. She wanted to increase her sales so she is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy flour, cooking oil and food coloring to use in making pancit miki. 

She hopes to develop her business and continue growing as an entrepreneur. She believes that someday, the family will achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and food coloring to use in making pancit miki

loans.name: Alexandrina

texts.en:
Alexandrina had been selling rice and livestock feeds to the people in her village for three years now. She usually acquire for about P5,000 each month. Her income goes for meals, allowance of her children and bills at home. Alexandrina is widowed. She had two children. One is still attending to school.
Alexandrina would like to improve her sales so she is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy a sack of rice and livestock feeds to sell. She hopes to acquire good income from the business that will someday lead her for financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice and livestock feeds to sell

loans.name: Felymar

texts.en: Felymar is 56 years old, married and had three children. Her spouse works as a company driver. To add up her spouse income, Felymar used her skills in sewing curtains, school and office uniforms. Aside from this business, she is also a Barangay(smallest unit of town)secretary at Estefania. She is happy to serve other people and at the same time generates income from her small business. As of now, one of her children still attends to school and Felymar wanted to gave the best education to her. Felymar needs for business improvement to acquire more profits from it. She is asking for P28,000 to buy fabric, threads and needles to use in her sewing services. She hopes to satisfy all her customers with good output from the sewing services and make it more profitable than before. Felymar will be very happy if her children will have a a good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads and needles to use in her sewing services

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina resides at Libag Sur with her spouse and four children. She had sent up all her children to school and now they had their own employment. She was happy that they helped her financially in times of need. Catalina doesn't want to rely on their remittances so she patiently generates an income from her hog raising business. She usually earn about P2,500 each hog she was able to disposed. This goes for meals and bills at home. 
Catalina would like to earn good profit from the business so she is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for the hogs. She hopes to make her pigs grow healthier to offer them at a good price. If she will achieve this, the income will be saved for future expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for the hogs

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada lived peacefully at Libag, with her spouse. She had three children. One is working abroad and the rest had their own families and live separately with them. Iluminada is thankful for earning profits from her business of hog fattening and breeding. Through her business, she was able to buy food for daily meals and pay for electric bills. Iluminada would like to strengthen her business. As of now, she is borrowing for P33,000 to buy vaccines, medicines and hog feeds. She had four piglets that needs for sustainability. 

Iluminada would like to ensure proper growth of hogs that will lead her to earn good profits from it. With enough fund, she will able to establish a more convenient pigpen for her hogs.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, medicines and hog feeds for sustainability

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is aged 41 and married with seven children aged between twenty and one year. He has been in farming in his rural home in Kitale, Western Kenya for over five years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces milk, maize and eggs for the local market. He also runs a motorcycle transport business.

Andrew has requested a loan of 82,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow at 52,000 KES and build a zero grazing unit at 30,000 KES.This is his fourth loan with Juhudi Kilimo after the previous three of 10,000 KES,45,000 KES and 80,000 KES respectively. He expects to get more returns from farming owing to his experience which runs to five years.

He reiterates joining Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services have been a great boost to his milk production and income.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Khadeja

texts.en:
Khadeja is photographed in her store for selling clothes.
Khadeja is a 31 year old young woman, she is married with no children yet, her husband is employed with low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's costs.

For the past three years, Khadeja has been opening a store for selling clothes, which has a good reputation among customers and located in a good movement area, this make her project a profitable one.

Khadeja is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing bulk of clothes for the coming summer season. This will offer to Khadeja new collection of summer clothes, which will enable her to compete others well and increase her sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase bulk of clothes for the coming summer season

loans.name: Muniratu

texts.en: Muniratu cooks food to sell at a village called Ayensudu near Elmina. Some of the foods she cooks are banku, wakye, and plain rice with tomatoes sauce, spicy black pepper and others. When given the loan she would use it to acquire additional tomatoes, beans and rice to enable her cook in large quantities for resale. She is presently living with four dependants and as a responsible parent she assists her spouse to provide the daily needs of her family. Any profit accuing from her increased income will be used to build a restaurant.

loans.use: to acquire additional tomatoes, beans and rice to enable her cook in large quantities for resale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married with three children. She operates a chop bar (a place where people are served with varieties of food). She prepares fufu which is made from cassava, banku from corn and serves it with different types of soups example groundnut soup or peanut butter soup and others. She will be using the loan when given to her to purchase cassava, tomatoes, corn and other ingredients that will enable her cook. The new profit will be reinvested into the food business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava, tomatoes, corn and other ingredients that will enable her cook.

loans.name: Ameeda Moro

texts.en: Ameeda fries doughnut to sell at a nearby school at Ayensudu near Elmina in the Central Region of Ghana. She serves the doughnuts with locally made drinks like ginger drink, millet drink and others. She is married. Her loan will be used to buy more items to enable her increase her sales. The new profit realized will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more items to enable her increase her sales.

loans.name: Ayishatu

texts.en: Ayishatu lives with her 4 children at Ayensudu a village near Elmina. She is into the sale of flour products such as dough nuts, chips, pies, and local drinks. She needs a loan from kiva to expand her food business. Her loan will be used to purchase flour, oil, sugar, essence and others for resale. She hopes to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase flour, oil, sugar, essence and others for resale.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is divorced and has 5 dependants. She sells different kinds of fruits (oranges, bananas, pineapple and others) at Ayensudu near Elmina in the Centrel Region of Ghana. She hopes to use the loan to acquire more fruits to sell. Her profit will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: to acquire more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Khadeja

texts.en:
Khadeja is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Ma'moon appears in her Kiva profile photo, photographed inside the family house while making repairs to it.
Khadeja is a 31 year old young woman, she is a mother with three sons and two daughters, her husbans is employed and gets a salary, but not enough to cover all the family's needs and paying the costs of repairing the house.

Khadeja is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of repairing and improving the house's condition such as: painting, changing windows and doors, fixing and changing the electric extensions. This will improve the house's conditions and create to Khadeja and her family suitable and healthy home conditions.

loans.use: To repair the family house

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
By this time, Wilfredo has been raising four piglets and it’s been five years of patience and sacrifices he had devote to make this business profitable. He is really thankful because through his livestock business, he is able to support his family and send his children in school. 

Wilfredo would like to educate his three children left,for it is the only thing that he could  give to his three children. He hopes that his children, could finish their degree courses so that they could find better opportunities after pursuing their courses. With regards to his main goal, he would like to take out for a loan amounting to P15,000 which will be use to buy feed supplies of his raised hogs to make them healthy and more bigger until they reach their optimum growth. He is hoping for continuous financial support of the lenders, to be able to have a better way of living and obtain higher income to sustain his family needs.

loans.use: to be use in purchasing feeds for livestock business

loans.name: Lope

texts.en:
For ten years of involvement to livestock business, Lope had able to support his family. He is now 49 years of age,married to Norma who is vegetable vendor. The couples were blessed with five children: two of them have been settled for marriage; the other two are laborer and the youngest is still studying.

Nowadays, Lope raised four piglets, he is happy to see that his business has improvement through the financial support given by the lenders to him.He already paid back his previous loan and ask for another loan in the amount of P22,000 which will be use to buy 20 bags of feeds and vaccine for the good nutrition of his raised hogs. 

Lope would like to educate his youngest child, because he doesn’t want to experienced what he has done during his young age. So, despite the hardship he had encountered in running the business still he endures all those things. He hopes that he could improve his business and make it more profitable so that he could continue to provide his family needs.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of feeds and vaccine for the good nutrition of his raised hogs

loans.name: Trifilo

texts.en:
Trifilo is industrious and simple man.Who is married to Pacita. The couple has been blessed with four grown up children. All his children have settled for marriage and have their own families.

Trifilo has been running his livestock business for eight years up to present.He aims to improve the growth of his raised hogs because he would like to earn bigger income.With his eagerness to obtain his goal in life and business, he is asking for bigger capital amounting to P15,000.This amount of loan will be use to buy stock feeds and vaccines to maintain the growth of his raised piglets. Trifilo would be glad if his business will be supported by all KIVA lenders continually.

loans.use: to buy stock feeds and vaccines to maintain the growth of his raised piglets

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a resident of Nkubu area of Central Kenya where he has been I active farming for over ten years with maize and cow peas and tobacco being the main supplies to the local market. He operates a retail shop in the local for additional income. He is aged 39 and married with three children with the first two already schooling.

Fredrick has requested a loan of 63,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the better breed of a dairy cow will provide income which he intends to use in educating the children. He hopes to grow the dairy business and supply external markets as well. 

He says inadequate rains is a n inherent problem that farmers in the area must learn to cope with.

loans.use: To pay for insurance and purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a business man,he does motorcycle transport business to earn a living,she has been in the business for 7 years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. To earn extra income he runs a green grocery store. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to improve his business and hopes to buy another motorbike in the future. He has applied for 90,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a business woman,she does welding to earn a living. She has been in the business for 8 years and has employed 2 people. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. She describes her customers as loyal because they visit her regularly. Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to improve her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Annbell

texts.en: Annbell is 31 years old,she sells decorations such as curios and carvings to earn a living. She has been in the business for 2 years and has employed three people. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy decorations for sell.

loans.use: To buy decorations for sell

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine is 29 years married to Amos. She has an M-pesa shop a business she has been doing for the past three years and earns a monthly income of KES 24,000. 


She wants to apply for more  business float in her business and therefore has requested for a loan of KES 30, 000. 


The profit from this business would help her open another M-pesa branch. Her dream is to buy a plot and build rental houses. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more business  float for her business.

loans.name: Jerusha

texts.en:
Jerusha is 52 years old.She is married to Zablon.Together they have three children.She sells second hand bags and has been in the business for the past 20 years .

This is her first loan from KADET LTD.She was introduced to KADET by a client.She will use the loan to purchase one bale of bags for resale.

She hopes to start selling new bags in the near future.

loans.use: Purchase a  bale of bags for resale.

loans.name: Bayandelger

texts.en:
Bayandelger is a 30-year-old married man who operates a clothing retail stall at a local indoor market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Aside from his business at the market, he works as an excavator specialist at Hera Investment Co., Ltd., a company that supplies heavy machinery and equipment. 

As Bayandelger is often called out of town, his wife runs their clothing business. They sell women’s clothing imported from Beijing, China. 

Bayandelger is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase more clothing for this spring. He is a trusted client of Transcapital Company, Ltd., and this is his third time on Kva and he always pays his loans successfully and on time. His goal is to own new apartment for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for upcoming season.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a married man aged 35 years old ,and a father of four children and are aged between eight and one years old.  Josphat owns a cereals, which has been in operation for a period of 15 years earning a monthly income of KES. 10,000.

He has applied for his second loan of KES. 40,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use the money to purchase 30 bags of dry maize 40,000 for sale.The profits will be used to plough back into the business and repay the loan.

His dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase dry 30 bags of dry maize for resale

loans.name: Review/timothy

texts.en: Timothy is 31 years old married to Beatrice and blessed with four children aged 11,10,8 and 4 years respectively. He owns a butchery shop, a business he ventured in a year ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. He has requested for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy more goat and cow meat for sale. The anticipated profit would help him repay his loan. His dream is to educate his children as well as expand his business. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more goat meat and cow meat for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 55 years old,married with three children. She does tea and livestock farming to earn a living. She has been in the business for 5 years and has employed two people. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to educate her children and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy fertilizer and two cows.

loans.use: To buy  fertilizer and two cows

loans.name: Tserenchimeg

texts.en:
Tserenchimeg, age 38, runs a clothing retail business at a local indoor market in Ulaanbaatar. 

Tserenchimeg usually sells women’s clothing imported from China, and this loan will help her to increase her product variety. She and her husband have two small children, ages 5 and 6. The family lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

Tserenchimeg is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to import more clothes for the spring, a very high shopping season. She is planning to expand her business by increasing her product variety.

loans.use: to import more clothes for the spring shopping season

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Bayarsaikhan, age 42, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She operates a clothing retail stall at a local indoor market and has made great progress in one and a half years of operation.

Bayarsaikhan has fifteen years of experience in the clothing retail business as she used to operate a retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, until 2007. Bayarsaikhan started her current business after working in Korea for three years. 

Bayarsaikhan has three children: her 23-year-old son works as a machinist at a local company and her 14- and 19-year-old children attend local university and high school. Her husband operates a small business in town. Bayarsaikhan is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes for the upcoming season. Bayarsaikhan is a responsible and very neat person who is intent on improving her family’s living standards and helping her children to become highly educated people in the future. She is also a trusted client of Transcapital Co Ltd.,

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Edemar

texts.en:
Edemar has been involved in agricultural business particularly in livestock. He is thankful because his previous loan had really help him, in obtaining his goal in life. Edemar would like to have continuous access of financial services to improve his livestock business.

For ten years of hard work and patience, Edemar had able to increase his income which serve to sustain their family needs.As additional source of income, his wife Beatriz had also engaged herself in farming business to help his husband in providing their basic commodities.

Edemar would like to take out a loan, amount of P15,000 which will be use in buying livestock feeds and vaccines to improve the growth of his raised piglets. He believes that the result of his labor will give him a fruitful outcome,that will lead to his success in life.

loans.use: to be use in buying livestock feeds and vaccines of raised piglets

loans.name: Erick

texts.en: Erick is 39 years old,married with 4 children. He does welding to earn a living,he has been in the business for 5 years and has employed 4 people. To earn extra income he does farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to educate his children and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine

loans.name: Ototo

texts.en: Ototo is 38 years old,married with two children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living,he has been in the business for 11 years and has employed two people. To earn extra income he runs a grocery store. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to improve his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar,rice,cooking oil and tea leaves for sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar,rice,cooking oil and tea leaves for sell

loans.name: Dedemus

texts.en:
Dedemus is a 56 year old farmer and married to Maria, a 36 year old lady. They are blessed with 5 children, they are: Febi, 20, is studying at a University in Jakarta; Desi, 18, studying in the 2nd grade of Senior High School; Gusti, 17, Noven, 14, is studying in the 6th grade of Elementary School; Mersy, 9, is studying in the 2nd grade of Elementary School. 

To make a living, Dedemus cultivates water spinach, string bean and mustard greens at his farm. In addition, Dedemus and his wife sell kind of cake such fried banana, ‘nagasari’ (rice-flour cake stuffed with banana slice inside and wrapped using banana leaves), fried cassava, etc. 

The limitation of income generated from the business led Dedemus to work hard to finance his children’s educational fees and daily needs. Therefore he is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,000,000 from TLM to enlarge his businesses. He would like to buy more ingredients to sell more cakes and also to buy seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to sell more cakes and also to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en: Nicholas is 35 years old,married with 3 children. He does motorcycle transport business to earn a living,he has been in the business for 2 years and describe his business environment as good because there is limited competition. He earns extra income from farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is photographed inside his store.
Ahmad is a 22 year-old- single young man, for the past three years, Ahmad has been opening a store for selling home electrical goods, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to him.

Ahmad is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing collection of different types of home electrical goods that has a good customers demand because of its affordable price. This will increase sales and improve Ahmad's income to better.

loans.use: To purchase collection of  home electrical goods for sale

loans.name: Ham

texts.en:
Ham, is a 46 year-old-man and married to Marita, 27 years old. Ham and Marita are blessed with 2 children: Aurelia, 8 and is attending the 3rd grade of Elementary School; Adrian, 11 months old. 

Ham owns a repair shop business which is located next to his house. Ham usually starts the business from 8 am to 6 pm. Ham has received a loan from TLM and has a good record.  The loan was very helpful for him in improving the business. 

Now Ham is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 4,000,000. The loan will be used to restock spare parts such spark plug, ball-bearing, gear wheel, brake-oil, lubricant, etc.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts such spark plug, ball-bearing, gear wheel, brake-oil, lubricant, etc.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is full of hopes in obtaining success in life. She is 48 years of age and widower. Since her husband died,she had able to take the responsibilities of being the father and mother to her three children. According to her,it's really quite hard to be the bread winner of the family,but she didn't have any choice but. So,she patiently care her family at the same time, run her specialized retail business.In this way, she could meet the welfare of her children. Two of her children had finished their degree courses while the youngest is still high school student whom she spends her income, due to the school fees and daily allowances. 

For now, she would like to ask for additional capital amounting to P10,000 allowing her to buy more tilapia to be sell within her local community to double her income.She hopes that she could make her business viable as source of income of the family. In a way, that she will no longer problem the daily allowances of her child and able to send her child in higher level of education.

loans.use: to buy more tilapia for her retail business

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, take the picture next to his taxi.

Manal is a 36 -year-old woman, she is married and a mother with two sons and two daughters, her husband is a taxi driver since three years ago who gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover his family needs.

Manal is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing new engine to the taxi instead of the old one. This will increase the taxi capacity of working and enable Manal's husband to work extra hours and take more internal requests,  this will lead to improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase new engine for the taxi.

loans.name: Apriyani

texts.en:
Apriyani is a 23-year-old lady who is married to Ayub, a 23-year-old man. They have a daughter namely Ajeng, 1-year-old. To assist her husband in generating money for their family, Apriyani runs a business producing various snacks such as banana crispy chips, fried corn, “kue rambut” a traditional fried cake made of rice flour mixed with palm sugar. 

Everyday Apriyani distributes the products from one kiosk to another. She also distributes them to the other districts. She believes that the business has good prospect for the future and enables her to generate more income for the family. Apriyani is thinking to enlarge the business by providing snacks in a large quantity. Therefore she is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. She would like to spend the loan on wheat flour, rice flour, banana, cooking oil, etc.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice flour, banana, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Saruul

texts.en: Saruul is a 49 years old woman who lives with her husband and 2 sons in Bayanhongor province in Southern Mongolia. Her husband makes construction decoration in summertime. She has been running meat retailing business since 1998. She has reliable suppliers who sells her fresh meats. She trades the meats at the trade center. The business has been successful and she has been improving the household alone in wintertime. Saruul is a responsible and good- natured woman who says that "I would like to expand the business activity by buying the supplies in large quantities". The total amount he is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy more meats at wholesale price.

loans.use: To buy more meats at wholesale price

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, take the picture in their house.

Yasmeen is a 24 -year-old young woman, she is married and a mother with one son, her husband is employed and gets low salary, which is not enough to cover his family's needs and pay for purchasing new home furniture.

Yasmeen is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new home furniture such as: living room furniture, bedroom furniture. Taking this loan will offer to Yasmeen and her family suitable and comfortable furniture to enjoy their living at home.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Naji

texts.en:
Naji is photographed in his store for selling home appliances.

Naji is a 22-year-old single young man, since four years ago, he has been opening a store for selling home appliances to customers, which is a profitable project and the only source of income to him.

Naji wants to expand the size of the store and purchase collection of home appliances for sale, so he is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover these costs.
Taking this loan will improve the store's condition through having large space and enable Naji to have more collection for sale,  This will increase sales and improve Naji's income.

loans.use: To expand the size of the store and purchase collection of home appliances for sale

loans.name: Ronak

texts.en:
Ronak is a 43 year old Iraqi woman, married and a mother of five children. 

She learned to sew at a young age and using her old machine she has been using her skills for the past five years to contribute to the family's income. Working from her home she makes dresses and other fabric household items based on her customers' orders.

Ronak took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 1800 USD to buy a new sewing machine, an over machine and fabric to be able to improve her services and be able to offer more to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, an over machine and fabric

loans.name: Karzan's Group

texts.en:
Karzan is a 21 year old ambitious Iraqi man. He is married and is working hard to build the foundations for a new family. He has been working in a Mini-market for the past three years, building it up nicely to meet the needs of his customers.

In the past, Karzan successfully applied, received and repaid a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq which he used to improve his store's appeal, renewing its walls and looks. 

Now, Karzan took a new loan to further improve the store; he would like to purchase a refrigerator and freezer to be able to expand his selection of goods.  

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and freezer for his mini-market

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en:
Ameena is photographed while choosing a carpet for her home.

Ameena is a 23 -year-old single young woman, her brother is a worker in a photography store who gets a salary, but not enough to cover all his needs and costs.

Ameena is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing necessary home furniture such as: living room furniture and carpets . Taking this loan will offer to Ameena's house better look and suitable furniture, this will allow Ameena and the rest of her family to enjoy living at home.

loans.use: To purchase necessary home furniture and carpets

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is photographed next to the bedroom furniture he will purchase.

Mohammad is a 23 -year-old single young man, he is employed and gets a low salary which is not enough to cover all his life costs.

Mohammad wants to purchase new bedroom furniture and living room seats to his house, so he is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover these costs of purchases. 
Taking this loan will enable Mohammad to have suitable furniture and enjoy living at home.

loans.use: To purchase new bedroom furniture and living room seats

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, take the picture in a store that sells home furniture.

Ola is a 33 -year-old young woman, she is married and a mother with three sons and three daughters, her husband is employed with a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs and the costs for purchasing new home furniture.

Ola is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new home furniture such as: bedroom furniture for her children and living room furniture. Taking this loan will allow Ola to offer her family suitable home furniture and provide to them better home living.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Ochirbat

texts.en: Ochirbat is a 54 years old man who lives with his son in the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running the business to do the housetops since 2006. He makes the top in the buildings or at the offices. Since his wife died, he left alone to be responsible for his son. Now he is trying to improve the household and save it for his son. His work is qualified and reliable. Because there are number of regular customers and clients. Ochirbat is a hardworking man who says that "I would like to expand the business activity by buying the necessary materials for the housetop business. I am planning to save more for my son's future". The total amount he is requesting is 690,000 MNT to buy the necessary materials to make the housetops.

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials

loans.name: Narouz

texts.en:
Narouz is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, take the picture in his house.

Narouz is a 33 -year-old young woman, she is married and a mother with three sons and two daughters, her husband is employed who earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover his family costs.

Narouz is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new living room furniture and improving the house's condition by painting it. This will improve the family's home living conditions positively.

loans.use: To purchase new living room furniture and painting the house

loans.name: Maruush

texts.en: Maruush is a 57 years old man who lives with his wife and 2 daughters in Bayanhongor province in Southern Mongolia. His wife is a retiree. He has started food market business in 1992. Then he started flour business. But since 2000, he has been running home furnishings and toys retailing business. After long research on different types of business, he found out this is the right and profitable business by which he can provide the family needs and has a future to be widened. Maruush is a good- natured man who says that "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing the supplies in large quantities so that I could save the transportation expenses to China and trade them in good prices to my regular customers". The total amount he is requesting is 1,450,000 MNT to buy home product and new toys.

loans.use: To buy home product and new toys

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for two years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Yar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is photographed next to the bedroom furniture she will purchase.

Ghada is a 42 -year-old woman, she is married and a mother with one son, her husband is employed with low salary, which is not enough to cover his family needs and costs.

Ghada is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing bedroom furniture for her only son and dinning room furniture. This will enable Ghada to offer better and comfortable home furniture to her family.

loans.use: To purchase bedroom furniture and dinning room furniture

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Khitam is a 39 -year-old woman, she is married and a mother with four sons and two daughters, her husband is a worker with low income, which is not enough to cover his family costs.

Khitam is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing bedroom furniture for her children and kitchen table. This will improve the family's home living condition to better.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Lana

texts.en:
Lana, 40 years old married lady. She has two daughters and two sons.
Lana has selling clothes at home recently, mainly to friends, relatives, and neighbors. She also added selling accessories to clothes. 
She has applied to this loan to buy more accessories and new spring clothes collection.

loans.use: to buy more accessories and new spring clothes collection

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 26 years old,married with 2 children. He does bicycle transport business to earn a living,he has been in the business for 3 years and has employed two people. He describes his business environment as busy because he has many regular customers. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 52,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Najiya

texts.en:
Najiya is a conservative person, she asked her husband Khaled to take her place in the photo. 
Najiya, 39 years old married woman. She has six sons and one daughter. 
Her husband owns a scrap shop from which he support the family; in addition to their eldest son’s salary.
Now Najiya wants to help her husband in improving his business, she has applied to this loan in order to expand the place and organize it to add more scraps in the future.

loans.use: to expand the place and organize it to add more scraps in the future.

loans.name: Shahinaz

texts.en:
Shahinaz is a conservative person, she has asked her husband to take her place in the photo.
Shahinaz, 36 years old married woman. She has three boys and a daughter. Her husband Yaser is a freelance transporter, her owns a pick up that he uses for this purpose.
Shahinaz at home does embroidery business to help in adding another source of income to the family. Now she has applied to this loan in order to buy a new sewing machine so she can expand in the future and open a big tailoring workshop.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Hafeetha

texts.en:
Hafeetha, 52 years old married woman. She has two boys and two girls. Her husband is a driver at a private companies.
Hafeetha has been knitting and embroidering for the last two years. During this period she was able to market her products in home products shops since most of her embroidered products and bed covers, pillow covers, and table sheets.
Now Hafeetha want to increase her productivity and make more items so she can open her own shop and sell her own products, she has applied to this loan to buy more threads and fabric to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy more threads and fabric

loans.name: Muntaha

texts.en:
Muntaha, 46 years old married woman, she has two sons and two daughters. 
After her husband retired from the military, he started working as a freelance pick-up driver. But Muntaha wanted to help her husband as he is getting older, so she has been making a special type of yogurt that is well-known in Jordan called Jameed. Jameed is used in the Jordanian traditional famous dish called Mansaf that everyone loves to eat.
She also make the ordinary yogurt beside Jameed, and she want to start making more dairy products so she has applied to this loan in order to buy a special machine that can help her expand and make more products.

loans.use: to buy a special machine to start making more dairy products

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 32 years old,married with 2 children. He sells used shoes to earn a living,he has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person. He describes his business customers as low income earners because they live in slums. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to improve his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy used shoes for sell.

loans.use: To buy used shoes for sell

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman, 40 years old married woman.  She has three daughters and an eldest son.
Iman has a small retail business selling clothes, she uses her husband experience when buying the clothes since he is a trader and owns a distribution shop. For that Iman gets a good quality clothes in a reasonable price and sells them in a good price. 
Now Iman wants to increase the amount of products she has to increase her revenue so she can one day open a clothing shop, for that she has applied to this loan.

loans.use: to bring the spring collection

loans.name: Hind

texts.en:
Hind, 43 years old married woman, she has no children. 
To fill up her time doing something useful, Hind started to make crafty decoration pieces and embroidery, she also make different kinds of dishes per order. Now she has applied to this loan to buy more tools and material to make new crafts.

loans.use: to buy more tools and material to make new crafts.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 30 years old,married with 2 children. He does taxi transport business to earn a living,he has been in the business for 4 years and describes his business environment as favorable because he has many regular customers. To earn a extra income he does dairy farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy new tires for his car.

loans.use: To buy new tires for his car

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel is 37 years old,married with 3 children. He does motorcycle transport business to earn a living,he has been in the business for 3 years and describes his business environment as busy because he has many regular customers. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 28 years old,married with 2 children. He does tailoring to earn a living,he has been in the business for 12 years and describes his business environment as busy because he has many customers who visit him regularly. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a tailoring machine.

loans.use: To buy a tailoring machine

loans.name: Wilson De Jesus

texts.es:
Wilson es una persona muy trabajadora que ha logrado superar grandes dificultades que le ha presentado la vida. Casado y con 2 hijos de 5 y 10 años de edad, Wilson se vio en la obligación de abandonar su municipio natal debido a las pocas oportunidades que encontraba para generar los ingresos que requería para sostener su hogar. Fue así como se desplazó hasta el municipio de Medellín junto con su familia y allí con gran esfuerzo empezó a estudiar diferentes posibilidades de negocio para comenzar a generar sus ingresos. Luego de pensar en muchas alternativas surgió la idea de tener un puesto de venta de papas y platanitos fritos; además encontró un lugar donde es muy concurrido tanto por estudiantes como por comerciantes de la zona, lo que hizo que se volviera muy atractiva la idea. Wilson ya lleva algunos meses con su negocio montado y este ha venido creciendo mucho gracias al esfuerzo que hace por posicionarlo y ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio. Y gracias a este esfuerzo que ha hecho, Wilson busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de un carro para preparar fritos para generar un empleo en su negocio, ya que la demanda de sus productos es superior a la capacidad que tiene Wilson para atenderla. 

De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo y Wilson podrá tener mayores ingresos para su hogar, de tal manera que su familia podrá gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y poco a poco irá cumpliendo su sueño de sacar sus 2 hijos adelante brindándoles una buena educación.

loans.use: Compra de un carro para preparar fritos para generar un empleo en su negocio, ya que la demanda de sus productos es superior a la capacidad que tiene Wilson para atenderla.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en: Arnold is 34 years old,he does tailoring to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years and has employed two people. To earn extra income he sells packed water and juice.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to improve his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a tailoring machine and cloth material for making clothes.

loans.use: To buy a tailoring machine  and cloth material for making clothes.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es:
Claudia ha tenido que superar muchas adversidades en su vida, pero gracias a sus ganas de trabajar y ganas de salir adelante ha podido superar estas dificultades y seguir progresando en su vida. Claudia es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de su hijo de 6 años debido a que se divorció de su esposo hace un tiempo, por tanto, Claudia debe garantizar unos ingresos en su hogar con los cuales pueda tener una buena calidad de vida para su hijo. Por enseñanza de su ex esposo aprendió el mantenimiento de computadores y montó un café Internet donde ofrece estos servicios a sus clientes. En su café Internet se ha caracterizado por ofrecer una buena atención a sus clientes y esto le ha permitido tener una gran clientela para su negocio. La gran ventaja con la que cuenta Claudia es que sabe realizar el mantenimiento de los equipos de su café Internet, por lo que no tiene que incurrir en altos costos para pagarle a alguna persona que le realice esta actividad. Aprovechando sus conocimientos, y debido a que requiere reparar un equipo de su café Internet, Claudia busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de los repuestos que requiere para realizar el mantenimiento de un equipo de su café Internet.

De esta manera su negocio seguirá prestando un buen servicio a sus clientes y así podrá seguir teniendo unos ingresos que le garanticen una buena calidad de vida. Claudia sueña con seguir teniendo un buen negocio y que este le permita en algún momento comprar una casa propia para ofrecerle a su hijo una mayor estabilidad económica.

loans.use: Compra de los repuestos que requiere para realizar el mantenimiento de un equipo de su café Internet.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en: Titus is a business man,he does motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years and has employed one person. He describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Focion Tulio

texts.es:
Focion es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, sus ganas de salir adelante le ha permitido superar las dificultades y seguir progresando en su vida. Focion es un padre soltero de su hijo de 10 años, pues su madre los abandonó hace un tiempo y debido a esto se vio en la obligación de garantizar el sustento necesario para su hogar. En un momento se quedó desempleado y debido a la urgencia  de generar ingresos para su hogar buscó a unos amigos suyos que tenían sus propios negocios. Uno de ellos se dedicaba a la compra y venta de cosechas de verduras, y le enseñó la actividad a Focion para que se dedicara a esto. Focion trabajó para el como empleado durante un tiempo mientras aprendía en su totalidad como se manejaba el negocio, y una vez aprendida la actividad montó su propio negocio para generar sus propios ingresos. Desde entonces, Focion viene trabajando en su negocio de compra y venta de verduras en el cual compra las cosechas a los campesinos y las vende en la plaza de mercado de su municipio, y gracias a esta actividad genera los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Con el ánimo de aprovechar algunos buenos precios, Focion busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de verduras al por mayor para ofrecerlas a sus clientes y así aprovechar los buenos precios de la temporada.

De esta manera, podrá acceder a precios bajos que se están ofreciendo en el momento y podrá tener un mayor margen de ganancia. Además, podrá seguir teniendo los ingresos que requiere para su hogar y su hijo tendrá acceso a una buena calidad de vida.

loans.use: Compra de verduras al por mayor para ofrecerlas a sus clientes y así aprovechar los buenos precios de la temporada

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 30 years old,married with 2 children. He sells small dried fish(omena) to earn a living. He has been in the business for 2 years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. To earn extra income runs a cereals store and sells firewood. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy small dried fish(omena)for sell.

loans.use: To buy small dried fish (omena) for sell

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is a business woman,married with 3 children. She sells mats and fabric to earn a living,she has been in the business for 4 years and describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy mats and fabric for sell.

loans.use: To buy mats and fabric for sell

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana se encuentra casada y tiene 3 hijos a quienes les ha querido ofrecer una buena educación. Debido a que los ingresos de su esposo no son suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hogar, Liliana se vio en la obligación de conseguir un empleo, y fue así como comenzó a trabajar como empleada doméstica en algunas casas. En una de ellas, se encontró con que una empleadora suya le enseñó a trabajar la actividad de la venta de productos de uso personal, y gracias a esto ha montado su propio negocio y lo viene trabajando en su tiempo libre; de esta manera genera ingresos adicionales para poder contribuir económicamente para el sostenimiento de su hogar, además de que así se paga sus estudios, pues está validando sus estudios de secundaria. Liliana de esta manera se ha encontrado con una mejor calidad de vida para ella y para su familia y por esto quiere seguir continuando con su negocio. Con el fin de aprovechar algunos precios de sus productos, Liliana busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal al por mayor para aprovechar los buenos precios de su proveedor y tener así un mayor margen de ganancia.

Liliana de esta manera podrá seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes, a buenos precios y tener un buen margen de ganancia, con lo que sus ingresos aumentarán considerablemente y su familia podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es seguir progresando con su familia, sacar sus 3 hijos adelante y terminar sus estudios de secundaria para estudiar alguna carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Compra de productos de uso personal al por mayor para aprovechar los buenos precios de su proveedor y tener así un mayor margen de ganancia.

loans.name: Octavio De Jesus

texts.es:
Desde muy joven Octavio aprendió la actividad de la fabricación de calzado, gracias a que su padre trabajaba en una empresa de calzado y se la enseñó desde temprana edad. Al aprender la actividad decidió montar su propio taller de fabricación de calzado el cual tiene más de 25 años de experiencia, y con el cual ha sacado su familia adelante. Octavio se encuentra casado y tiene 4 hijos de quienes manifiesta son su mayor motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio. En su taller se ha caracterizado por ofrecer a sus clientes una gran calidad en sus productos y ofrecer muy buenos precios, por lo que ha tenido la oportunidad de captar un gran número de clientes para su negocio. En la actualidad, su negocio tiene más demanda por parte de sus clientes que la capacidad con la que cuenta para responder esta, por lo que Octavio está trabajando fuertemente para poder nivelar su capacidad de producción. Adicional a esto, a Octavio se le ha averiado una de sus máquinas, por lo que busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la reparación de una de sus máquinas y la compra de materias primas para la fabricación del calzado.

Octavio espera seguir creciendo en su negocio y seguir teniendo un buen taller de fabricación de zapatos. Además, Octavio espera que de esta manera su familia siga teniendo una buena calidad de vida y sueña con generar varios empleos en su taller.

loans.use: Reparación de una de sus máquinas y la compra de materias primas para la fabricación del calzado.

loans.name: Sarly

texts.en: Sarly ha sido cliente de Fundación Mujer desde el 2005,los créditos que se le han dado han sido para invertir en la compra de equipo y materiales que utiliza en su salón de belleza, cuya actividad realiza desde aproximadamente 10 años. En esta ocasión Sarly ha solicitado un pequeño crédito para poder cubrir los gastos de trámite de su divorcio ya que si saca ese dinero de su capital de trabajo , esto le afectaría la compra de su material de trabajo. Es por esta razón y la trayectoria que ella tiene como cliente de Fundación Mujer que le ha sido aprovada su solicitud de crédito.

loans.use: For the purchase of hair products

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia, es odontóloga y tiene su propio consultorio  en la casa de sus padres.
El crédito lo requiere para pagar la especialización en ortodoncia y posteriormente obtener más ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Patricia, es soltera y no tiene hijos vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Pasankeri la misma ubicada en la ciudad de La  Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.

loans.use: costo de especialización en ortodoncia.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
Jacinto, se dedica a la compra y venta de vehículos y también trabaja como chofer  propietario.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de llantas para su vehiculo ya que es uno de los ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
Jacinto, es casado y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la zona de Tacagua la misma ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.

loans.use: Compra de llantas para su taxi.

loans.name: Ivanka

texts.es:
Ivanka, trabaja  de lunes a sábado como empleada en un supermercado de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito requiere para pagar la matricula de la universidad y de esta forma culminara sus estudios para obtener mejores ingresos y  ayudar a su familia.
Ivanka es  soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres  ubicada en la zona Miraflores de la ciudad de  La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.

loans.use: pago de matricula en la Universidad para continuar sus estudios.

loans.name: Robin

texts.es:
Robin, trabaja como chofer en una empresa en el departamento de Potosí y viaja constantemente.
El crédito lo necesita para pagar los estudios de su hijo menor.
Robin, es viudo y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la zona San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente trabaja por quinta vez junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez con KIVA. El crédito se encuentra bien respaldado, pues presenta garantía prendaria y personal.

loans.use: gastos de pensiones de su hijo menor en la secundaria.

loans.name: Colombe Group

texts.en:
Jacques, age 56, is married with 5 children. He has 4 children attending school. He operates a butcher shop in a local market in Brazzaville.

 He has had this business for 21 years! He has gained many valuable customers and a lot of business experiences over the years. Jacques will use the loan to buy more fish, chicken, and beef to sell in his shop. When asked about difficulties he has with his business, Jacques responded that he needs larger loans. He is a very hard working ambitious entrepreneur! 

Jacques has received 3 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a very good repayment record. He hopes to one day be able to travel outside of Brazzaville to buy meat. He wants his children to be successful and would like to see them work for HOPE Congo.

loans.use: to pay for fish, chicken, and beef.

loans.name: Santa Veronica

texts.es:
Santa es un ejemplo de mujer luchadora que ha dado todo de sí por el bienestar de su familia, ella y su esposo siempre están pendientes del buen estado de su pequeño de 6 años, al cual aman y cuidan mucho. Santa disfruta mucho tejiendo chompas, ya que realiza bonitos y nuevos diseños exclusivos para su pequeño.

Santa de dedica a manejar moto taxi desde hace 2 años, tiempo en el que ha aprendido, con algunas dificultades, las rutas para los destinos a los que desean acudir sus clientes. Ella trabaja a partir de las 7 de la mañana, ya que es en esas primeras horas donde la cantidad de sus clientes se incrementa, y ya es a las 8 y 30 de la noche, cuando puede regresar a casa con el dinero suficiente para los alimentos diarios de sus pequeños.

Actualmente ella necesita hacer un reforzamiento mas el pintado de la parte base de la moto con el fin de que se encuentre en mejor estado y de esa manera pueda visitar mayor cantidad de clientes y transportarlos a zonas más alejadas, con este apoyo, ella podrá incrementar sus ingresos y a su vez su calidad de vida, lo que la llevará a motivarse mucho más y cumplir con su gran sueño: “Mejorar su vivienda y contar con nuevas movilidades “

loans.use: Para el reforzamiento y pintado de la base de su moto taxi.

loans.name: Les Enfants Unis 2 (#1) Group

texts.en:
Marina, age 22, is a single mother with 2 children. Both of her children are attending school. She runs a small bakery where she sells pastries and cakes in a local market. She has had this business for 7 years. Marina will use the loan to buy sugar and flour. Her strategies are to offer good quality products and to bake and sell the most popular products. She tries to provide what her customers like best. 

Marina has received 3 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She has a very good repayment record. The rain poses a great difficulty to her because her stand in the market does not keep out the rain. She hopes to build a more fortified stand, and as she grows to eventually build a boutique. She will continue to receive the loans from HOPE Congo because they are helping her to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for sugar and flour.

loans.name: Les Enfants Unis 2 (#2) Group

texts.en:
Silvere, age 37, is a single father with 2 year old twin boys. He owns a butcher shop in a local market.

 He has operated this business for 1 and a half years. He purposely located himself in a specific community where there was not a butcher shop. He feels this has been an important factor with his business' success.

 Silvere will buy a refrigerator and a small generator. The electricity in Brazzaville is unreliable, and if it is off for too long his meat will spoil. The generator will allow him to keep his freezers and refrigerator running even if the electricity goes out. 


Silvere has received 3 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a very good repayment record. As he continues to grow, he wants to be eventually transport live fish to Brazzaville from the coast. This will allow him to stock a greater variety of fish as well as offer very fresh fish to his customers. He hopes that his 2 boys will be successful and wants to be able to provide them with a good education.

loans.use: to pay for a refrigerator and small generator.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam ahora se dedica completamente a la venta de cosméticos y a la venta de productos de belleza para ambos sexos de forma independiente.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más productos al por mayor, cremas de limpieza, maquillajes, desodorantes, etc., para diversificar su mercadería y de esta forma obtener más ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Miriam, es casada y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en una casa alquilada en la zona de San Pedro la misma ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, se dedica a la venta de batidos (cerveza negra mezclada con huevo y un poco de azúcar en una batidora) y jugos en la puerta de una iglesia en la ciudad de La Paz y también cuenta con los ingresos de su esposo el cual trabaja en una entidad pública como empleado de limpieza.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de 20 bolsas de cemento y una camionada de arena para la refacción de su vivienda para brindar más seguridad a su familia
Maria, es casada y tiene un hijo, vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Pasankeri en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.

loans.use: Compra de arena y cemento para refaccionar su casa y dar más comunidad a su familia.

loans.name: Liz Miriam

texts.es:
Liz, una mujer de 26 años de edad tiene un pequeño de 4 años, al cual saca adelante vendiendo ropa para adultos y niños de forma ambulatoria. Liz ha enfrentado los fuertes temblores y lluvias que han originado algunos problemas ligeros en su vivienda, pero que con mucha dedicación y fuerza ha aprendido a poder superarlos.

Liz se levanta diariamente muy temprano con el fin de atender bien a su pequeño, antes de ir a vender, su trabajo consiste en caminar e ir visitando a las personas que viven en las zonas en donde vende sus productos. Ella siempre ha deseado salir adelante por ella y su pequeño, el cual es su principal motivo.

Actualmente sus clientes se han incrementado un poco debido a que con la nueva temporada escolar, los padres necesitan algunas prendas para sus pequeños.

Con un poco de ayuda, Liz podrá comprar ropa nueva ( Pantalones, polos, blusas, etc.), lo que le permitirá generar mayores ingresos y poco a poco cumplir su gran sueño “Tener un nuevo negocio y tener un local en el mercado”, lugar en el que se generan la mayoría de sus ventas.

loans.use: Para la compra de ropa nueva ( Pantalones, polos, blusas, etc.)

loans.name: Ada Crizalida

texts.es:
Ada es una mujer de 53 años de edad, es conviviente, con 1 hijo. Tiene buenas relaciones con sus vecinos. Vive en Oyotún, con buenas referencias personales.
La actividad que desarrolla Ada es la venta de productos de primer necesidad, tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, menestras, en una bodega, la cual esta en una parte de la sala de su domicilio. Además  cuenta con buen nivel de inventarios para su negocio. 
El monto solicitado por Ada es de 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales serán utilizados en la compra de mercadería para surtir bodega, productos como leche, huevos, útiles de aseo, etc. para así seguir creciendo en su negocio y llevar una mejor calidad de vida junto a su esposo.

loans.use: Compra de alimentos de primera necesidad: leche, huevos, etc. para surtir su bodega.

loans.name: Jessica Alexandra

texts.es: Jessica Juárez es Licenciada en Comercio Internacional, está solicitando el crédito para pagar una especialización en Marketing. Dentro de algunos años se ve desempeñándose como una especialista en una naviera, ganando dinero suficiente para solventar sus gastos y ayudar en algo a los que una vez le dieron la mano. Le inspiran su hija y su papá, para que su hija sepa que a pesar de las limitaciones que ha enfrentado ha podido salir adelante y que se sienta orgullosa de su mamá, y su papá por que le pudo cumplir en terminar su carrera.

loans.use: Pagar una especialización en Marketing

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en casa propia, tiene 02 hijos que mantiene. Él vive en la zona del Caserío Las Juntas en el distrito de Pacora y cuenta con servicios de  luz y agua en su domicilio. El lugar donde vive es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Mercedes es la crianza y venta de animales, por la zona de Pacora.Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio, vende especialmente ganado caprino y ganado porcino. Es ayudado por su esposa, quien también percibe ingresos por agricultura ya que se dedica al jornal.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 2000 nuevos soles, los cuales se invertirán en la compra de animales, sobre todo de ganado caprino, y también para la compra de alimentos para sus animales. Esto con la finalidad de engordarlos, tener más ganado y cotizar mejor sus productos, incrementando sus ganancias.

loans.use: Compra de ganado caprino y compra de alimento balanceado para ganado.

loans.name: Sandra Ines

texts.es: Sandra es una persona muy luchadora que ha podido superar grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Sandra se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos, de los cuales 1 de ellos en una hija que tiene una discapacidad y debe cuidar todo el tiempo. Desde el momento en que nació su hija con discapacidad, Sandra ha venido superando grandes obstáculos en su vida, los cuales le han enseñado a tener fortaleza y luchar siempre por lo que quiere. En una fundación donde contribuyen con el servicio de salud de su hija, Sandra aprendió la elaboración de artesanías como títeres, muñecos, bolsas de regalo, entre otros, y con el dinero que genera vendiendo estos productos puede comprar la droga que requiere su hija, ya que es bastante costosa. Es por esto que Sandra quiere que su negocio siga saliendo adelante y pueda seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos con la cual pueda comprar el medicamento de su hija, por lo que busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas como telas, papeles, entre otros para la elaboración de sus artesanías, y seguir teniendo ingresos para pagar el costo de los medicamentos de su hija.

loans.use: Compra de materias primas como telas, papeles, entre otros para la elaboración de sus artesanías, y seguir teniendo ingresos para pagar el costo de los medicamentos de su hija.

loans.name: Martha Aracely

texts.es: Martha está estudiando la carrera de Licenciatura en Contabiliada Pública y Finanzas, cursando el último año de la carrera, está solicitando el préstamo para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios. Actualmente está laborando, y con sus ingresos paga sus estudios. Su inspiración para alcanzar sus metas es su hija quien ve en mí un ejemplo a seguir y desea darle lo mejor y ser un modelo excelente para ella. Tiene una espíritu emprendendor que la mueve a alcanzar sus metas, se esfuerza por obtener excelente notas en sus clases.

loans.use: Pagar curso de titulación

loans.name: Teolinda

texts.es:
Teolinda es una mujer de 50 años de  edad, es viuda y mantiene a 1 solo hijo pues los demás ya son independientes. Su casa es propia y es de material semirústico.Se ubica en su parcela agrícola en la cual tiene mango y limón el cual cosecha semanalmente generándole ingresos. Su domicilio se ubica en Caserío Hualtaco II que está a 8 Km de Tambogrande, cuenta con servicio de luz pero no con agua ni desagüe.
La actividad que desarrolla el titular es el negocio de crianza de animales como pavos, gallinas y también vende limón que cosecha de su parcela semanalmente generándole ingresos con los cuales va a afrontar presente crédito.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 1500 nuevos soles, y lo solicita para la compra de alimento para sus aves y mejoras en su corral y seguir creciendo en su actividad. De esta manera, genera más dividendos y crece en su negocio, haciéndose conocido en la zona y captando más clientes.

loans.use: Compra de alimento para sus aves y mejoras en su corral.

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es:
Yamileth se vio en la obligación de abandonar su municipio natal desde hace un largo tiempo en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales y mayores oportunidades económicas para ella y su familia. Yamileth se encuentra casada y tiene 4 hijos a quienes les ha querido ofrecer una buena calidad de vida. Con la necesidad de generar ingresos para contribuir en su hogar, Yamileth aprendió de su hermano la actividad de la compra de excedentes industriales de tela para venderlos en pequeñas cantidades a sus clientes, y de esta manera pudo montar su propio negocio para tener unos ingresos en su hogar. El negocio desde el momento en que lo han montado ha crecido mucho, y ahora su esposo le colabora en este para poder atender todos sus clientes. Con el ánimo de seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes, Yamileth busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de excedentes industriales de tela para venderlos a sus clientes en pequeñas cantidades.

De esta manera, Yamileth podrá tener mayores ingresos para su hogar y podrá seguir obteniendo una buena calidad de vida para ella y su familia. Además, Yamileth espera que su negocio le cumpla el sueño de tener su casa propia y dejar de pagar los altos costos del arriendo.

loans.use: Compra de excedentes industriales de tela para venderlos a sus clientes en pequeñas cantidades.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermín es un hombre de 52 años de edad, es un hombre casado y sin hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposa,la cual está ubicada en el Caserío San Pedrillo en el distrito de  Tambogrande. Fermín vive en la parte rural  de este distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz eléctrica en su domicilio.
La actividad que desarrolla Fermín es la agricultura, pues tiene 1 hectárea de terreno agrícola, en la cual tiene sembrado limón y mango, ambos en producción. El limón lo cosecha semanalmente. Además se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral. Complementariamente es peón agrícola en los fundos del caserío. Su esposa lo apoya en la crianza de las aves de corral.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 500 nuevos soles, que serán destinados en la compra de fertilizantes y úrea para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de limón, mejorando de esa manera su producción y la calidad de sus productos.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es un joven padre de 20 años, el cual tiene 2 pequeños, por los que se esfuerza y se dedica a trabajar diariamente un promedio de 12 horas con el fin de poder darle lo mejor a ellos y a su esposa, la cual también ha buscado la manera de poder sacar adelante a su familia, es por ello que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en un mercado de la ciudad en donde viven, Chincha, Perú.

Eduardo siempre ha demostrado ser luchador, y es por eso que con mucha dedicación ha logrado realizar la compra de una moto taxi hace unos años, la cual es su principal fuente ingresos familiares. El piensa que le va bien en su negocio porque siempre ha demostrado respeto por los clientes a los que transporta y siempre ha mantenido los mismos precios, lo que le está permitiendo poder transportar a más clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.

Con un poco de ayuda, Eduardo podrá realizar el mantenimiento que su moto taxi necesita y es así como brindará un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que también le permitirá tener un mejor funcionamiento y desempeño en su labor diaria. Con este apoyo el ahora se siente capaz de lograr el éxito y cumplir su gran sueño “Tener una casa propia y sacar a sus pequeños siempre adelante”

loans.use: Para el mantenimiento de su moto taxi.

loans.name: Paulina
