loans.name: Sory Fiorella

texts.es:
Sory es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus playas hermosas, por sus atractivos turísticos como las Islas Ballestas y el candelabro de Paracas; también es conocido por una de sus actividades principales como la pesca y la agricultura y sobre todo por la amabilidad de su gente. Cuando Sory tiene un tiempo libre le gusta leer , sobre todo obras literarias además de comer uno de sus platillos favoritos, el cual es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”; debido a los pocos recursos económicos solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar administración de empresas.

Sory con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro, logro iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes al día; ella cree que le va bin en su negocio porque es muy carismática y amable con los clientes y sobre todo ofrece productos de calidad a precios cómodos.
Sory está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la gran ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería en especial ropa de otoño; con lo cual podrá tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y así mejorar sus ingresos lo que le permitirá seguir luchando cada dia para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Estudiar la carrera de administración”.

loans.use: Para la compra de mercaderia (ropa de otoño)

loans.name: Chamreun

texts.en:
Chamreun (in the photo) is 62 years old, lives in a village about fifteen kilometers form Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She is a widow with three sons and two daughters. Two are monks, one is a garment worker, another one attends school and another one is still young.

Chamreun is a scarf weaver. She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase cotton threads for her scarf weaving business.

loans.use: To change from wooden stilts to cement concreted stilts.

loans.name: Chhantha

texts.en:
Chhantha (pictured here) is 51 years old, lives in a village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. She is a widow with two sons and two daughters. One is waiter, another one is a security guard and two have full-time employment. 

Chhantha is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,500 to purchase a motorcycle for her son who is a waiter for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son for commuting.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly es una joven de 21 años de edad, la cual es muy carismática y sobre todo entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Pisco; ciudad que se caracteriza por sus playas hermosas, por sus atractivos turísticos como las Islas Ballestas y el candelabro de Paracas; también es conocido por una de sus actividades principales como la pesca y la agricultura y sobre todo por la amabilidad de su gente. Cuando Magaly dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, sobre todo jugar vóley con sus amigas y amigos; asimismo le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con  Pollo”. Sus padres la querían mucho, pero debido a sus pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Hotelería y Turismo.

Con mucho esfuerzo logro ahorrar y tener su negocio de venta de abarrotes en la bodega que tienen en su casa; ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 40 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de calidad a precios cómodos y sobre todo es amable con los clientes.

Magaly está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio, en especial azúcar, arroz, fideos, enlatados, entre otros; lo que le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos y mejorar sus ingresos para así poder seguir luchando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.

loans.use: Para la compra de mercaderia (azúcar, arroz, fideos, enlatados, entre otros)

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap (in the photo), age 32, sells soft drink, Cambodian sweet. Her husband, Niem, age 37, is a driver. They live in a village about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh and have two daughters who are attending school. 

Sopheap is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to expand her business by buying more soft drinks for resale.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Soaphalyneth

texts.en:
Soaphalyneth (in the photo) is 23 years old and her husband; Heng is 24 years old, live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2011 and have one little son.

Soaphalyneth stays at home and take cares of her son. The main source of income is from her husband’s salary who has full-time employment. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy new motorbike for her husband to get work.

loans.use: To buy new motorbike for her husband to get work.

loans.name: Tsatsa's Buleg Group

texts.en:
Tsatsral is a 29-year-old young lady entrepreneur who has two children, who are two and four years old. Both of them attend kindergarten. Her family lives in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, which is located in the outer ger district (a district without basic infrastructure) of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.

Tsatsral has been supporting her family by operating a clothing retail stall at the largest outdoor market of Mongolia, for six years, with the help of her spouse. She usually sells women's clothes, which she imports from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. As she is a friendly person, she has already had her own constant customers. Tsatsral wants to expand her business in order to increase her working capital. 

So she is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase clothes from Ereen city to sell for this high shopping season. Her long-term goal is to improve her living conditions by renovating her current small ger.

She is a group leader and she overarmed on the picture.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for upcoming season

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim (in the photo), age 41, is a widow mother with three children-one is a tailor and others are garment workers. She lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Lim stays at home and does house work. The main source of income is from her children’s salary. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy a motorcycle for her son for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her son for commuting.

loans.name: Sokkal’S Group

texts.en:
Sokkal was selected to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are three families including her. All the group's members live on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

1-Sokkal, age 52, is a weaver. She is a widow with three children-two sons and one daughter. One is a designer and two are in school. She is requesting a loan of $100 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business. 

2-Sophea, age 39, is a weaver and her husband is a soldier. She has three children-one son and two daughters. One is married and lives separately and others attend school. Sophea is requesting a loan of $100 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business. 


3-Ny, age 60, is a weaver. She is a widow mother with one son two daughters. One is a security guard, another one is garment worker and another one is a housekeeper. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.  

Photo: Sokkal is on the left, Ny is in the middle and Sophea is on the right.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Sichan

texts.en:
Sichan (in the photo) is 31 years old and her husband; Chantha is 25 years old, live in a village about 30 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2005 and have two children who are in school. 

Sichan is a rice farmer, while her husband is a construction and assists his wife in rice farming when he is free. Sichan is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her brother to get work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her brother to get work.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is 49 years old and married with 3 children.

Isidra works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Isidra has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Isidra aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stocks to sell

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy (pictured on the left and her sister on the right), age 26, is single. She lives with her parents and brother and sister in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her parents are farmers. 
Sophy is a garment worker. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle to get work because she commutes to work by taking motor remoque. Taking a remoque to work is expensive.    

A remoque is a motorbike connected with a trailer at the back.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to get work.

loans.name: Ma. Roselyn

texts.en:
Ma. Roselyn is 28 years old and married with 2 children.

Ma. Roselyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Ma. Roselyn has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock.

Ma. Roselyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Macrina works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from "nipa" making. Macrina is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Macrina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Reina

texts.en:
Reina works hard to support her family. Reina is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Reina requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business.

Reina has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Reina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy aingredients for her business

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta works hard to support her family. Aniceta is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Aniceta requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Aniceta has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Aniceta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 40 years old and married with 2 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, spices, etc.. 

In the future Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 52 years old and married with 6 children.

Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Delia has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and entertainment(videoke) rental.

Delia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married with 5 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gloria is 45 years old and has 3 children who are in school.

Gloria has a buying and selling vegetables and spices business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional vegetable to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetable to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 30 years old and married with 6 children. With 5 children in school, Jean works very hard to provide for them.

Jean runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Jean has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Jean would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang is 54 years old and her husband; Sokhom is 57 years old (pictured together), live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1983 and have two sons and two daughters. Two are married; one is a garment worker and has full-time employment.   

Samnang sells vegetables. She buys vegetables from Phnom Penh market and transports them to resell in her local market. Her husband stays at home. He wants to launch a motor remoque taxi driving business. Hence Samnang decides to apply for a loan of $1,300 to buy a motor remoque for her husband.

A motor remoque is a motorbike connected with a trailer at the back.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and a trailer for her husband to launch motor remoque taxi business.

loans.name: Pablita's Group

texts.en: Pablita is the leader of a two person group, Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.Pablita is married with 4 children. Pablita is 60 years old and lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin. Mis. Occ.  Pablita has a general store to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, and sacks of rice for her business. Pablita has been a member of PMPC for 5 months. In the future, Pablita hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: To purchase canned good, softdrinks for additional capital

loans.name: Juliebeth

texts.en:
Juliebeth is 41 years old and married with 2 children. With one child in school, Juliebeth works very hard to provide for them.

Juliebeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Juliebeth has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, noodles, snack foods, etc.. 

In the future Juliebeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en:
Lailanie works hard to support her family. Lailanie is married and has a buying and selling of dry goods business in the Philippines.

Lailanie requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks for her business.

Lailanie has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Lailanie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks for her business

loans.name: Lodrina

texts.en:
Lodrina is 58 years old and widowed with 10 children.

Lodrina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Lodrina has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables and raising chickens and fish vending.

Lodrina aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Manchita

texts.en:
Manchita works hard to support her family. Manchita is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Manchita requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle maintenance.

Manchita has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Manchita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Antonio Jr.

texts.en: Antonio Jr is from Western Pob.Lopez Jaena. He is 36 years old, married, and has 2 children. To make a living, Antonio Jr owns & operates a fishing business, harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community. His 3 years in this business and earns 8,000 monthly. In 2009, Antonio Jr joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Soheng

texts.en:
Soheng (in photo) is 41 years old and her husband; Ang is 44 years old, live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990 and have one son and two daughters. One is a garment worker and others are in school.   

Soheng is a rice farmer, while her husband is a motor taxi driver and he also assists his wife in farming business when he is free. Soheng is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her daughter to get work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her daughter to get work.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 63 years old and married with one child. She is borrowing 50,0000 php through NWTF to buy stocks to sell.

Angela has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drink, liquor, canned goods, snack food, egg, etc.. 

In the future Angela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks to sell

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 37 years old and married with 4 children who are currently going to school. Belen works very hard to provide for them.

Belen runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Belen has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, egg. Sardines,  noodles, soap, etc.. 

In the future Belen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Kimeng

texts.en:
Kimeng (in photo) is 43 years old and her husband; Hongleng is 42 years old, live in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1992 and have five children who are in school.   

Kimeng is a morning grory farmer, while her husband is a construction worker. Kimeng is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her husband to get work because he commutes to work by taking bicycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to get work.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena works hard to support her family. Elena is widow and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Elena requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy fresh fish and other sea foods to sell.

Elena has been in this business for 35 years now.

In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and other sea foods to sell

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
For over five years in Paypayan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Celia, a 56-year-old married mother of five children, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2009, Celia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc.

loans.name: Srey Chim

texts.en:
Srey Chim (in the photo) is a garment worker, while her husband, Chanthy is a fisherman and raises pig at home. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have one daughter who is in school. 


Srey Chim wants to stop working as a garment worker and start her own tailoring business. She will have much time to take care of her house. So, she is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.use: To launch tailoring business by buying sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.name: Map

texts.en:
Map is 38 years old and her husband; Vandoeun is 46 years old, live in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have four daughters-three attend school and another one is still young.  

Map and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, her husband is also a fisherman and a motor taxi driver. Map is asking for a loan in the amount of $300 to buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

Photo: Map is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou (pictured here) is 27 years old and her husband; Bunthoeun is 31 years old, live in suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers and they have two young daughters. 

Chanthou sells grocery items and food at her home, while her husband is a garment worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to expand her grocery inventory by buying more grocery items.

loans.use: To expand her grocery inventory by buying more grocery items.

loans.name: Larry

texts.en: Larry is from Western Poblacion Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. He is 28 years old and married with two children. To make a living, Larry operates a barber shop which is a family business. He provides haircut services to local community members. Larry has been in his business for 8 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Larry joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Larry is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional equipment & tools such as scissors,etc. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment & tools such as scissors,etc.

loans.name: Visal

texts.en:
Visal (in the photo), age 35 and his wife, Sarom, age 36, live in a village about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one son and one daughter who are in school. 

Visal is a rice farmer and raises cow at home, while his wife sells fruits. He is asking for a loan of $1,300 to purchase new motorbike for his brother because the old one breaks and uses more gasoline.

loans.use: To purchase new motorbike for his brother.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom (in the photo) is 28 years old and her husband; Ravy is 32 years old (pictured together), live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2000 and have two young daughters.    

Sreymom sells fish, while her husband is a motor taxi driver. She is applying for a loan in the amount of $800 to expand her business buy buying more fishes for resale.

loans.use: To expand her business buy buying more fishes for resale.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng (pictured with her son) is 47 years old and her husband, That is 43 years old, live in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have six children-four sons and two daughter. One is a garment worker, three attend school and other two are still young.   

Heng is a weaver, while her husband is a construction work. In addition, when farming season come, they also rice, sesame and sugarcane farmer. Heng is applying for her first loan in the amount of $700 to buy seeds and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng (pictured with her loom), age 44, is a weaver. Her husband, Nao, age 48, is a construction worker and raises cow at home. Besides the business, the couple also grows sesame and bean when farming season come. They live in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have six children-five sons and one daughter. One is a garment worker, three attend school and other two are is still young.  

Seng is applying for her first loan in the amount of $500 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her sesame and bean farm.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her sesame and bean farm.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz, married, having 4 children. Luz is 49 years old, resides in Tipan, Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Luz owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been 2 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000.00 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 7,000.00 to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. 2009, Luz joined GDMPC. In the future, Luz wants to build house and to finished the study of her children.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc.

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en: Rufa is married, 55 years of age, and lives in Paypayan, Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental together with her 7 kids. Rufa produces and sells charcoal to local members to earn a living. She has been in this business for 4 years and she earns 1,200 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making. She joined GDMPC in 2009. Rufa wishes that their business will be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Daisy, a 45-year-old married mother of 2 children, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2009, Daisy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc.

loans.name: Micah

texts.en: Micah is 55 years old,married with 4 children. He sells human medicine to earn a living,he has been in the business for 4 years and has employed one person. He describes his business environment as good because he has many regular customers. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to educate his children and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy human medicine for sell.

loans.use: To buy medicine for sell

loans.name: Enos

texts.en: Enos is 28 years old,he sells fruits to earn a living. He has been in the business for 4 years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy fruits for sell.

loans.use: To buy fruits for sell

loans.name: Zolbaatar

texts.en: Zolbaatar is a 24 years old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in Govi-Altai province in Southern Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and takes care of the children. He has graduated from the college of Music and Dance. Now he is running the garment retails business. He trades different styles of pants, leggings and trousers with the stylish shoes. He has a well positioned shop counter at the big trade center in the town. Zolbaatar is a hardworking man who says that "I would like to expand the business activity by buying the supplies in large quantities from the capital city. I will save the transportation expense and spend it on the supplies". The total amount he is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy more pants at whole sale price.

loans.use: To buy more pants at whole sale price

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 60 years old and widowed with 5 children. Cristita works very hard to provide for them.

Cristita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Cristita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soft-drinks, beverages and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Cristita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Dolorosa

texts.en:
Dolorosa works hard to support her family. Dolorosa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Dolorosa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, sugar and other miscellaneous items.

Dolorosa has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Dolorosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, sugar and other miscellaneous items

loans.name: Josema

texts.en:
Josema is 47 years old and married with eight children.

Josema works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, shampoo, and other goods to sell in her store.

Josema has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Josema aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, shampoo, and other goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. Delia is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like pants, blouses and other clothing to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, blouses and other clothings.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en: Purevsuren is a 59 years old woman who lives with her husband and 3 children in Govi-Altai province in Southern Mongolia. Her husband is specialist of NSO daughters study at the college. The youngest son studies at the local secondary school. She has been running garment retails business since 2005. The business has been successful and profitable. She has many regular customers in the town who are happy to purchase the goods from her. Purevsuren is a diligent woman who says that "I would like to expand the business activity by buying the supplies in wholesale to increase the types of goods". The total amount she is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to buy more garment.

loans.use: To buy more garment

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Debbie works hard to support her family.

She has a wholesaling and retailing salt business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Debbie is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her salt making business.

Debbie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her salt making.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 61 years old and married with 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lucy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to purchase merchandise to supply her general store.

Lucy has been in this business for 40 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to supply her general store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 45 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Virginia has been farming vegetables for 5 years and also earns additional income from hog raising.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. Susan is married and has a pottery making business in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her pottery.

Susan has been in this business for 15 years now, and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 37 years old,married with 3 children. She sells used clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years and describes her business environment as busy because many people do business in that environment. Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy used clothes for sell.

loans.use: To buy used clothes for sell

loans.name: Ajok

texts.en:
Ajok lives in Bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is 38 year old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Ajok heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 in order to purchase beans, rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice for sale.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a single lady with one child aged three years old.  She owns a retail shop in Kapsabet and has been in operation for a period of three years earning a monthly income of KES. 3,500. 


She is  borrowing his first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use the amount to purchase sugar, cooking fat, washing bar soaps, bread ,wheat flour, and maize flour. 

The profits will be used to repay the loan and he hopes to improve her business and her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking fat, washing bar soaps, bread ,wheat flour, and maize flour.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is 25 years old,married with 2 children. She sells fruits and vegetables to earn a living,she has been in the business for 8 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to improve her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy fruits and vegetables for sell.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is married man, aged 33 years old and a father of four  children aged between eight,six, four and one years old.  He buys and sell milk and has been in operation for a period of four years earning a monthly income of KES. 6,000.

He is servicing a loan of KES. 20,000 as his first term loan from KADET LTD and wishes to use the loan to pay the milk suppliers.  The profits will be used to plough back into the business and repay the loan. He wishes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To pay the milk suppliers

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 34 years old, married to Gladys and blessed with three children. He sells potatoes a business he started a year ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He has requested for a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more Irish potatoes for sale. The profit he makes will be ploughed back to his business. His dream is to expand his business and improve his living standard. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is 38 years old,married with 2 children. He sells clothes and bags to earn a living,he has been in the business for 5 years and describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy clothes and bags for sell.

loans.use: To  buy clothes and bags for sell

loans.name: Tartha

texts.en:
Tartha lives in Bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is 34 year old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Tartha heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 in order to purchase beans, rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 54 years old,married with 6 children. She sells firewood to earn a living,she has been in the business for 9 years and has employed one person. To earn extra income she does farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to educate her children and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy firewood for sell.

loans.use: To buy firewood for sell

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer lives in Bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is 38 year old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Amer heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 in order to purchase beans, rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bean, rice for sale.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert is 30 years old,he sells bags and shoes to earn a living. He has been in the business for 4 years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to grow his business and hopes to own a boutique in the future. He has applied for 25,000 Kenya Shillings to buy bags and shoes for sell.

loans.use: To buy bags and shoes for sell

loans.name: Nyiel

texts.en:
Nyiel lives in Bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is 32 year old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Nyiel heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 in order to purchase beans, rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice for sale.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for five years. She is 38 year old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Ayen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a young client aging 27 years, married and has one child.

Ahmad is an owner for a food market since 2010 selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fishes, dairy products. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is being well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $3000 loan in order to make sliding door, ceiling for his market and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to make sliding door, ceiling for his market and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Atong

texts.en:
Atong lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 36 year old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Atong heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 55 years old,married with three children. He sells cows and goats to earn a living,he has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person. To earn extra income he does farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shilling to buy goats and cows for sell.

loans.use: To buy goats and cows for sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 20 years old married to Linah and blessed with four children. He sells pyrethrum, a business he started a year ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. He has requested for a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more pyre thrum for sale. 

The profit he makes will be ploughed back to his business. His dream is to educate his children. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of pyrethrum for sale.

loans.name: Awel

texts.en:
Awel lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 38 year old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Awel heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Atem

texts.en:
Atem lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for two years. She is 38 year old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Atem heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Lachica's Group

texts.en:
Lachica is married with two children. She is 56 years old and lives in Tuburan District Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur.

She has a shop that sells different kind of clothes. She had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 18000 of to purchase more stocks for her clothing business.

She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to open another shops for expansion.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her clothing business

location.town: Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: Prisca is 31 years old,married with 3 children. She sells carpets,mats and fabric to earn a living. She has been in the business for 4 years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to improve her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy carpets,mats and fabric for sell.

loans.use: To buy carpets,mats and fabric for sell

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 19 years old and lives in Lapidian, Pagadian City. He is single.

Eugene is a farmer and sells vegetables & rice grains for a living. He has been doing this for three years. He has requested a loan of 4000 to purchase more stocks for her farm supplies business.

Eugene has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future he hopes to expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her farm supplies business

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 29 years old single and supports three members of his family. He sells livestock, a business he started four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He has requested for a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more cows for sale. The profit he makes will be ploughed back to his business. His dream is to expand his business. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle for sale.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is 30 years old married to Monica and blessed with three children aged four, three, and one year respectively. He owns a retail shop, a business he ventured in a year ago and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He has requested for a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase a bale of baking flour, detergents and boxes of bar soaps. The anticipated profit would be ploughed back to his business. 

His dream is to educate his children as well as expand his business. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of baking flour, detergents and boxes of bar soaps.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is a married man aged 28 years blessed with two children aged four and two years old.  He operates a retail shop in Kapsabet and has been in operation for a period of six years earning a monthly income of KES. 6,000.

He has borrowed a loan of KES. 20,000 as his first loan from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase rice, bread, sugar, tealeaves, wheat flour and maize flour. 


The profits will be used to plough back into the business. He wishes to expand his business and be self sustainable.

loans.use: To purchase stock for his business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Twenty seven year old Gladys is married to Philemon and blessed with two children. She owns a retail shop, a business she started a year ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested for a loan worth KES 10, 000 to purchase packs of sugar, salt, boxes of bar soaps and detergents for sale. 

The profit earned from the business will help her repay her loan and expand her business. Her dream is to see her business expand and to educate her children. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase  packs of sugar, salt, boxes of bar soaps and detergents.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 37 years old married to Elias and blessed with one child. She runs a tailoring shop, a business she started 10 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 


Veronica has applied for a loan of KES. 20,000, which she will use to purchase clothe materials for sale. Her profit will contribute towards her buying a plot. She hopes to improve her family’s living standard.. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase clothe materials for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 31 years old and is not yet married.  He has owned his fruit and vegetable  business for five years.  He plans to use his loan to buy more fresh fruits and vegetables for sale. 


With the anticipated profits he intends to buy a motorbike that will enable him to transport produce faster.  He dreams of expanding his business large enough to be able to support a family and employ others.

loans.use: to buy  more fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 26 years old,married with one child. She runs a cafeteria to earn a living,she has been in the business for 3 years and describes her business environment as good because she has many regular customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy furniture for her cafeteria and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her cafeteria and cooking oil

loans.name: Abul

texts.en:
Abul lives in Bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is 38 year old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Abul heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 in order to purchase beans, rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans rice for sale.

loans.name: Vakhid

texts.en:
Vakhid is 50 years old. He lives in Gardabani District with his big family: wife – Sigjun, 26 years old son, daughter in law, parents in law and brother in law. Vakhid works as a taxi dirver in the district. Along with his main job, Vakhid is actively involved in family agricultural business. They have 2 milk cows and sell milk in the village. Along with the above-mentioned the family has rented land, where broom is grown. Sigjun makes brooms and sells them on local market Total average monthly income of the family is 1100 Laris, including the pensions of Vakhid’s parents in law. 

Vakhid requested credit for purchasing thee milk cows. The family will be able to sell more milk. It will increase the monthly income of the family on average by 450 Laris. They will be able to increase spending on their own needs and improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en: Teresiah is 31 years old and a mother of one child. She sells used shoes to earn a living,she has been in the business for 2 years and has employed one person. To earn extra income she does vegetable farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy used shoes for sell.

loans.use: To buy used shoes for sell

loans.name: Kubai

texts.en: Kubai is a married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 6 years. He describes himself to be as ambitious. He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as sugar, salt, blueband, stationery etc. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located at a conducive environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of goods sold. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more home products such as sugar,salt etc. His business goal is to run another retail store  within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more home products for selling.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a 52 year old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 25 years to 34 years. He describes himself to be faithful and honest. He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as sugar, salt, blueband, stationery etc. He has been involved in this business for 6 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located at a conducive environment. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficcient funds for expanding the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more home products such as sugar,salt etc. His business goal is to run a wholesale shop .

loans.use: to buy more home product for selling.

loans.name: Athau

texts.en:
Athau lives in Bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for two years. She is 34 year old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Athau heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 in order to purchase beans, rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice for sale.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley is a 57 year old married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 26 years to 34 years. He describes himself to be honest and ambitious . He operates a motor vehicle where he provides transportation services to customers. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located at a good market area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high price of oil . He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy motor vehicle spare parts. Within five years, Stanley's dream and  business goal is to own at least five more vehicles.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle's spare parts.

loans.name: Melkyanus

texts.en:
Melkyanus is a 28-year-old-man who is married to Femi, a 21 year old lady. They are blessed with a 2 year old baby girl, named Zena. Melkyanus is an agricultural product supplier. He usually buys various agricultural products from farmers such vegetables, tomatoes, chilies, fruits, etc to be sold at the market in town. He also sells agricultural products that are harvested from the farm belongs to his father in law, such as tomatoes, chilies and cabbages. He is grateful for his father-in-law allows him to cultivate on his farm.
Melkyanus is planning to sell more agricultural products and therefore seeking a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. Melkyanus used to receive a loan from TLM and had a good record in repaying the loan. He would like to spend the loan on seedlings of cabbage, tomato, chili, mustard green, fertilizer, and disinfectant.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings of cabbage, tomato, chili, mustard green, fertilizer, and disinfectant.

loans.name: Laban

texts.en: Laban is a married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 9 years. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as sugar, salt, wheat flour, maize etc. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located at a conducive business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of home products. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more home products. Laban's dream and  business goal is to venture into new business of vehicles.

loans.use: to buy more home product for selling.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, 39 years old married with three school-aged children. Marilyn is engaged in hog raising business for two years. She is asking a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy a sack of feed and piglet for her business. Marilyn is very responsible parents she make sure that she give all the need of her family. She hopes that someday her business expand to give the quality of living to her family.

loans.use: to buy sack of feed and piglet for her business

loans.name: Yublina  Kabnani

texts.en:
Yubliana is a 47 year old lady with 4 children. Richard, 20, is studying at University; Rani, 18, is studying at Senior high School grade 3; Rini, 12 is studying at Junior High School grade 1; and Charles, 10 is studying at Primary School grade 4. 

Yublina is a housewife who usually spends her time to take care of her family and to run 2 businesses i.e. Kiosk and pig breeding. Yublina runs these businesses for one reason that is to gain extra income for her family especially for the children’s schooling cost. The increasing needs of her family, especially the children schooling fees drove Yublina to enlarge her pig breeding business; she would like to buy 2-months-old pigs to be fattened. Therefore Yublina submitted a loan application to request a loan of IDR 5,000,000, from TLM and she is hoping that the loan will help her in improving her business income.

loans.use: to purchase 2-months-old pigs to be fattened.

loans.name: Colette Chantal

texts.fr: Agée de 43 ans, Colette Chantal  est mariée et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés . Elle a une boutique dans laquelle elle vend des divers et fait  en plus de la poissonnerie, avec une expérience de 06 ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la place. Elle aimerait accroître son stock et maximiser son profit pour le bonheur de la famille.
texts.en:
Colette Chantal is 43 years old, married, and mother of three children, all of whom have had schooling.

She has six years of experience running a shop where she sells a variety of items, and selling fish as well. She stocks up at one of the local markets.

She would like to increase her supply and maximize her profit for the happiness of her family.

loans.use: to buy 1 box of spaghetti, 1 carton of milk, 1 box of fish, 1 box of meat

loans.name: Rasto

texts.en:
Rasto is 29 years old and is married and with a four year old daughter.  For the last two years he has been running a bicycle transportation business where he transports people and goods around Nakuru town.

With this loan he plans to buy a new bicycles for transport and hopes to eventually buy a motorbike to offer his customers efficient services.

loans.use: to buy more bicycles for his transportation business.

loans.name: Nyalawa

texts.en:
Nyalawa lives in Bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Nyalawa heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 in order to purchase beans, rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice for sale.

loans.name: Misheck

texts.en: Misheck is a married man. He has a son who is 5 years old. He describes himself to be aggressive man. He operates a grocery store where he sells vegetables and fruits such as mangoes, kales, onions, tomatoes, cabbages etc. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located within a busy viable market for the business and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor road network to his area of operation leading to low purchasing power from customers. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more vegeables and fruits for selling. His business goal is to venture into a wholesale shop within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 54 years old married to Sophia and blessed with seven children. He is a farmer, a practice he ventured in 12 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES.30,000. 

He has requested for a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase fertilizer and seeds in preparation for the planting season. The profit he makes will help him improve on his financial status. 

Jackson’s dream is to see his farming practice expand to greater levels, this is his second loan.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds in readiness for the planting season.

loans.name: Blandina

texts.en:
Blandina is a 46 year-old-widow, she is living with 6 children, namely: Ariyanto, 18, is studying at the 3rd grade of Senior High School; Hengky, 15, is studying at the 3rd grade of Junior High School; Sonya, 13 is studying at the 2nd grade of Junior High School; Ivander, 12 is studying at the 1st grade of elementary school; and Oktovianus, 5 years old. 
Since the death of her husband Blandina took over the responsibility of taking care of her children in their education and daily needs. Blandina used to work as a salesclerk but she was sick and decided to resign from the job. She also worked to wash clothes from one house to another.
As the income generated was insufficient she decided to run a kiosk business. She expected the kiosk business can help her in generating more income. She started the business using her own money. Blandina plans to add more stocks in her kiosk. She is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. She would like to purchase sugar, coffee, soap, detergent, toothpaste, instant noodle, etc.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, coffee, soap, detergent, toothpaste, instant noodle, etc
